image.altText: A generic photo of an unidentified backpacker looking towards a solar farm.

props.synopsis: Workers say they are being exposed to dangerous conditions on solar farms, including working near live cables in wet weather or being put at risk of electrocution.

title.children: 'I knew something wasn't right': Workers sound alarm about unsafe conditions on solar farms

image.altText: A worker wearing a face mask works on a production line manufacturing bicycle steel rims in China.

props.synopsis: The prime minister sees an agenda to grow local green manufacturing as not only economically and strategically vital, but a political no-brainer. But that's only if it all works.

title.children: Albanese says a change as big as the industrial revolution is coming — you could call it the 'government intervention revolution'

image.altText: A drone shot of a mostly sunken ship wreck near a beach.

props.synopsis: An untold amount of black, toxic oil is contained within the corroding wrecks of World War II ships scattered around the Pacific. And it's leaking into the ocean.

title.children: These rusting shipwrecks are a big drawcard for divers. They're also ticking time bombs

image.altText: A for lease sign at a picket fence

props.synopsis: Australian renters facing all-time high asking rents and record low vacancy rates across the country, but there could be relief in sight.

title.children: Australian renters face all-time high rents and record low vacancy rates after prices jump in March quarter

image.altText: President Biden wears sunglasses in a suit speaks behind a lectern to a journalist.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden indicates the United States could abandon its prosecution of the Australian WikiLeaks founder ahead of revealing plans to develop an integrated missile defence system with Australia and Japan.

title.children: Biden 'considering' dropping pursuit of Assange as US, Australia plan missile system with Japan

image.altText: Lindsey Graham speaks at a podium while Donald Trump watches from behind.

props.synopsis: The former president hoped his abortion video would take the issue "out of play" before November's US election, but even some of his allies are determined not to let that happen.

title.children: Trump's anger at a Republican ally exposes his election ploy – and how it threatens to backfire

image.altText: Young woman wearing patterned blouse, with hair pulled back by loose headscarf, standing on bridge with trees in background.

props.synopsis: What's driving so many Australians to take to the streets to speak out about the war in Gaza? Some are connected to the cause, others are embracing activism for the first time.

title.children: Shula has been called a 'traitor' by some in her former community. She wants to offer them a challenge

image.altText: A stylised image of a mother cradling a baby.

props.synopsis: Damning claims by an SA government whistleblower have been levelled against the way child protection authorities are removing newborns from their mothers at public hospitals, sometimes just minutes after giving birth.

title.children: A whistleblower says mothers who 'haven't actually completed the birthing process' are having babies removed

image.altText: A man with a shaved head wearing a bandana over his mouth

props.synopsis: Russian authorities launch a crackdown on immigrants in the wake of the county's deadliest terror attack in a decade, as posts on social media point to an increase in racial tension and attacks.

title.children: 'People have lost their minds': In Russia, race hate takes hold after terror attack

image.altText: A woman holding photos of her three children.

props.synopsis: In Japan, thousands of children are cut off from their mum or dad every year as victims of a system that incentivises parental child abduction. The country will soon introduce laws that will enforce joint custody, but it's only caused more division.

title.children: 'Love you no matter what': Izumi's kids were photographed calling for her death, but she won't stop fighting for them

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wants to funnel taxpayer-funded incentives towards advanced manufacturing and clean energy projects, as Australia tries to compete with US President Joe Biden's massive spending plans.

title.children: Albanese reveals public investment plan to compete with US Inflation Reduction Act

image.altText: Women dressed in blue line up outside a building

props.synopsis: A man won a discrimination decision after being refused to a ladies lounge in a Tasmanian art gallery; it has raised questions about the law — and how men-only clubs can exist.

title.children: Discrimination ruling over Mona Ladies Lounge raise questions about women-only, men-only spaces

image.altText: elon musk stands and looks past a crowd

props.synopsis: Are you part of the Musk "cult"? Many Aussies have turned against the Tesla CEO even as the electric car-maker outsells the Toyota Hilux.

title.children: 'Dealing with a cult': Is Elon Musk hate hurting Tesla sales?

image.altText: A man with white hair and facial hair looks seriously at the camera. Behind him is an Indigenous print.

props.synopsis: Stricter alcohol restrictions, boosting school enrolment and more NDIS coordinators in remote communities: What needs to happen now and into the future to prevent another crisis in Alice Springs?

title.children: Beyond curfew, Alice Springs leaders outline what they want done

image.altText: A woman holds a spray bottle with her mouth open

props.synopsis: Many women have a reduced quality of life due to recurring urinary tract infections, but several vaccines and treatments are being trialled that may help prevent the debilitating condition.

title.children: Oral spray vaccine for UTIs shows promise for preventing 'warrior's disease'

image.altText: City office-workers and passers-by watch the ASX board in Sydney

props.synopsis: A fall on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks lower after data showed US consumer prices rose more than expected in March, diminishing hopes for how much and how soon the Federal Reserve can cut interest rates. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX to fall as hot US inflation erodes hopes for rate cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian renters face all-time high asking rents
Wall Street ends sharply lower as sticky inflation dims rate cut hopes

image.altText: Hamas Chief Ismail Haniyeh points as he makes a speech in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Three sons of Hamas' top political leader Ismail Haniyeh have been killed by an Israeli air strike in the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Hamas leader accuses Israel of killing his sons in 'spirit of revenge and murder' in Gaza

image.altText: A man in framless glasses, wearing a black tracksuit and facemask arrives in court flanked by officers

props.synopsis: Allen Weisselberg has pleaded guilty to lying to investigators and a judge about his involvement in determining the value of Donald Trump's Manhattan townhouse.

title.children: Former financial officer for Donald Trump's property empire jailed for lying in fraud cause

image.altText: A man wearing a green shirt with white stripes standing behind brown shrubbery with a blue sky behind him

props.synopsis: It's been likened to coral bleaching, but on land — and experts are fearful dry conditions have Western Australia on the brink of another devastating 'forest collapse' event.

title.children: Ecologists warn of second 'forest collapse' event in WA as record dry spell continues

image.altText: Josh Byron and his Kelpie teammates smile and wave to the crowd

props.synopsis: As Queensland becomes the first state to sign a MoU with its male players, Aussie Kelpie Josh Byron believes men's netball is on the verge of something great.

title.children: Aussie Kelpie Josh Byron is thriving in men's netball, after a short sabbatical trying to make it in the AFL

image.altText: Margot Priday in a white polkadot top with cars in the background

props.synopsis: Margot Priday was forced to move house after a former councillor and lawyer who had been a family friend broke through her garage and attacked her in April 2022. He remains in the community on bail ahead of sentencing later this year.

title.children: Former Sydney councillor assaulted 81yo in her own home in an 'unforgivable' attack

image.altText: On right a woman covers her face as she walks out of court, on left an old man speaks as a young woman listens

props.synopsis: In the final months of the 2020 presidential election, a Florida woman found herself holding what she thought could be the answer to her financial problems – Ashley Biden's diary.

title.children: In the last days of the 2020 US election, a 'despicable' plot unfolded to expose a diary by Joe Biden's daughter

image.altText: a photo of guy in flannel shirt standing in front of house with solar panels

props.synopsis: More and more Australians choose to live off-grid, but one electrical engineer warns it is expensive and "not for wimps".

title.children: 'Off-grid living not for wimps': Are Australians ready for the great green transition?

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young family, a man, woman and two kids

props.synopsis: A woman from the small town of Numurkah is calling for improved responses to a mental health crisis in Victoria following her late partner's death by suicide.

title.children: Victorian woman calls for better mental health emergency support in wake of partner's death

image.altText: An animated panda in a straw hat stands with his hands on his hips.

props.synopsis: Cinema's fluffiest martial arts warrior returns for his fourth outing. What keeps audiences coming back for more?

title.children: How does the fourth instalment of a kids' animation make $90 million on opening weekend?

image.altText: A number of adults in protective headgear, surround a boy in a padded room preparing to grab him. All faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: A damning review finds the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission failed to close a controversial program that put children with disabilities at risk of death despite reports from officials and families that it was using prohibited restraints.

title.children: Former judge criticises NDIS commission's response to controversial autism program

image.altText: Penny Wong sits with her arms crossed in the Senate

props.synopsis: In floating the possibility of Australia recognising a Palestinian state, Penny Wong said the quiet thing out loud and in doing so tore open one of the most sensitive decades-old debates.

title.children: Wong planned to say the quiet thing out loud. Her critics were quick to pounce

image.altText: A TV reporter stands holding a microphone with "7" on it, next to a swimming pool at the Tokyo Olympics.

props.synopsis: AOC president Ian Chesterton and colleagues and friends from multiple networks pay tribute to former Sunrise and Olympics reporter Nathan Templeton after his death at the age of 44.

title.children: Tributes flow after former Channel Seven Sunrise and Olympics reporter Nathan Templeton dies at 44

image.altText: A woman holding her shirt smiles at the a close up camera

props.synopsis: Abby Sturgess, 23, will spend at least six months in prison for fatally striking Norong cyclist Anthony Reeckman while distracted by social media on her mobile.

title.children: Young Victorian driver who hit and killed cyclist while using social media on her phone sentenced to jail

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie carrying an umbrella surrounded by journalists

props.synopsis: Former Seven Network producer Taylor Auerbach's lawyer has made further submissions to the court in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's 'silence was deafening' in response to new evidence, Taylor Auerbach's lawyer says

image.altText: A three-panel split image showing a smiling young blonde woman, harsh bushland, and a smiling middle-aged blonde woman.

props.synopsis: About 16 per cent of all women allegedly killed by men in Australia this year have died in the Ballarat region. It may sound like an absurd figure, but data shows the rate of family violence in the Victorian town is higher than state and national averages.

title.children: What the hell is going on in Ballarat? With three women dead in two tragic months, it's a question worth asking

image.altText: Karoline Dawe and Kylie Ward wearing nice evening dresses outside a gala event.

props.synopsis: The boss of a peak national nursing body is one of three executives who have been stood down pending an independent investigation into "potential financial irregularities" within the organisation.

title.children: Nursing executives stood down pending investigation of 'potential financial irregularities'

image.altText: A young girl in a red dress lies in a hospital bed, smiling, giving the thumbs up signal, with a toy dog.

props.synopsis: Juiced TV is a world first — a show made for kids in hospital by kids in hospital, and it's proved so beneficial at the Queensland Children's Hospital there are plans to roll it out nationally.

title.children: Being a kid in hospital can be scary, lonely and boring, but not if you're busy making and starring in a TV show
